posts.name: Ulberg
posts.cooked: Hello, I have a question about to how program an IPAC 2 for a button board in VS Code. I have downloaded the firmware and software for the IPAC 2, but I do not know how to “connect” the software of the IPAC to VS Code so VS Code is able to recognize the specific ports that the buttons are connected to. I want to program to do something along the lines of “if this button is pressed then execute a certain piece of code”

link_counts.title: Need Some Programming Advice for a Custom Button Board

posts.cooked:
The IPAC board is 2 Joysticks.  You’ll see them both in Drivestation and windows joystick control panel.

So, you’ll do something like:

For each…

Then you create buttons for each button…

You can use the windows control panel or Drivestation to find the button number.

Then you can use it just like any other Trigger (aka Button).

Apart from autonomous commands, which are scheduled at the start of the autonomous period, and default commands, which are automatically scheduled whenever their subsystem is not currently in-use, ...

link_counts.title: Binding Commands to Triggers — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Chris Cross
posts.cooked: Thanks!  Hopefully this makes sense to our programmers.  We’ve only ever used the XBox controllers.  Using a new type of controller was confusing us. So, just so I can wrap my head around this (I am not a programmer at all), we wire up all the buttons that we will use to the IPAC and connect it to the laptop via USB cable.  The Drivestation software should recognize the IPAC as two joysticks.  Then we need to determine which button is connected to which IPAC input/terminal and program those buttons like in your example above.  Is that the gist of it? Thanks again for your help.
You got it.  You should read the specs on the board before wiring to make sure you understand some of the fancy ports on it.

posts.name: Ulberg
posts.cooked: I have looked in the drivestation, windows control manager, and the device manager and I can not find the numbers anywhere. The button board is on and running but the driverstation does not give button id numbers.

The easiest way IMHO is to use the windows control panel.  Plug your IPAC into your driver station laptop.  Launch the Joystick control panel (Windows not FRC).  I think you hit “settings” and it should bring up a display of the joystick axes and buttons.  The buttons have their numbers light up when pressed.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Have you followed the directions to make the IPAC show up as joysticks? I think out of the box it looks like a keyboard.

posts.name: Ulberg
posts.cooked: I have the IPAC_2 configured as a vjoy device. When I go to the windows control panel all I see are 11 red dots for buttons. There are no button numbers. I have tried using the vjoy configuration as well as the universal control remapper. I can not find the id numbers for the buttons on anything.

You can see the number in the little circles…

(This is an Xbox controller but it works the same.)
